verses.kjv: And all the congregation lifted up their voice, and cried; and the people wept that night.
verses.ct: The entire community raised their voices and cried out, and the people wept all that night.

verses.kjv: And all the children of Israel murmured against Moses and against Aaron: and the whole congregation said unto them, Would God that we had died in the land of Egypt! or would God we had died in this wilderness!
verses.ct: All the Israelites complained against Moses and Aaron. The whole community said to them, "We wish we had died in Egypt! Or even here in this wilderness!"

verses.kjv: And wherefore hath the LORD brought us unto this land, to fall by the sword, that our wives and our children should be a prey? were it not better for us to return into Egypt?
verses.ct: "Why has the LORD brought us to this land just to be killed in battle? Our wives and children will be captured! Wouldn't it be better for us to go back to Egypt?"

verses.kjv: And they said one to another, Let us make a captain, and let us return into Egypt.
verses.ct: They said to each other, "Let's choose a new leader and go back to Egypt."

verses.kjv: Then Moses and Aaron fell on their faces before all the assembly of the congregation of the children of Israel.
verses.ct: Moses and Aaron dropped to the ground face-down in front of the entire assembly of Israelites.

verses.kjv: And Joshua the son of Nun, and Caleb the son of Jephunneh, which were of them that searched the land, rent their clothes:
verses.ct: Joshua son of Nun and Caleb son of Jephunneh, who were among those who had explored the land, tore their clothes in grief.

verses.kjv: And they spake unto all the company of the children of Israel, saying, The land, which we passed through to search it, is an exceeding good land.
verses.ct: They spoke to the whole Israelite community and said, "The land we traveled through and explored is an incredibly good land.

verses.kjv: If the LORD delight in us, then he will bring us into this land, and give it us; a land which floweth with milk and honey.
verses.ct: If the LORD is pleased with us, he will lead us into that land and give it to us — a land overflowing with milk and honey.

verses.kjv: Only rebel not ye against the LORD, neither fear ye the people of the land; for they are bread for us: their defence is departed from them, and the LORD is with us: fear them not.
verses.ct: Just don't rebel against the LORD, and don't be afraid of the people living there. We will swallow them up easily. Their protection is gone, and the LORD is on our side. Don't be afraid of them."

verses.kjv: But all the congregation bade stone them with stones. And the glory of the LORD appeared in the tabernacle of the congregation before all the children of Israel.
verses.ct: But the whole community talked about stoning them with rocks. Then the glory of the LORD appeared at the tent of meeting to all the Israelites.

verses.kjv: And the LORD said unto Moses, How long will this people provoke me? and how long will it be ere they believe me, for all the signs which I have shewed among them?
verses.ct: The LORD said to Moses, "How long will these people treat me with contempt? How long will they refuse to trust me, despite all the signs I have performed among them?

verses.kjv: I will smite them with the pestilence, and disinherit them, and will make of thee a greater nation and mightier than they.
verses.ct: I will strike them with a plague and destroy them, and I will make you into a nation greater and more powerful than they are."

verses.kjv: And Moses said unto the LORD, Then the Egyptians shall hear it, (for thou broughtest up this people in thy might from among them;)
verses.ct: But Moses said to the LORD, "Then the Egyptians will hear about it! After all, you brought these people out from among them by your power.

verses.kjv: And they will tell it to the inhabitants of this land: for they have heard that thou LORD art among this people, that thou LORD art seen face to face, and that thy cloud standeth over them, and that thou goest before them, by day time in a pillar of a cloud, and in a pillar of fire by night.
verses.ct: They will tell the people living in this land about it. They have already heard that you, LORD, are present among this people, that you, LORD, appear personally to them, that your cloud stands over them, and that you go ahead of them in a pillar of cloud during the day and a pillar of fire at night.

verses.kjv: Now if thou shalt kill all this people as one man, then the nations which have heard the fame of thee will speak, saying,
verses.ct: If you kill all these people at once, the nations that have heard about your reputation will say,

verses.kjv: Because the LORD was not able to bring this people into the land which he sware unto them, therefore he hath slain them in the wilderness.
verses.ct: 'The LORD was unable to bring these people into the land he promised them with an oath, so he slaughtered them in the wilderness.'

verses.kjv: And now, I beseech thee, let the power of my LORD be great, according as thou hast spoken, saying,
verses.ct: So now, please, let the power of my Lord be displayed as great, just as you declared when you said,

verses.kjv: The LORD is longsuffering, and of great mercy, forgiving iniquity and transgression, and by no means clearing the guilty, visiting the iniquity of the fathers upon the children unto the third and fourth generation.
verses.ct: 'The LORD is slow to anger and rich in mercy, forgiving sin and rebellion. Yet he does not leave the guilty unpunished, bringing the consequences of the parents' sin on the children to the 3rd and 4th generation.'

verses.kjv: Pardon, I beseech thee, the iniquity of this people according unto the greatness of thy mercy, and as thou hast forgiven this people, from Egypt even until now.
verses.ct: Please forgive the sin of this people because of your great mercy, just as you have forgiven them from the time they left Egypt until now."

verses.kjv: And the LORD said, I have pardoned according to thy word:
verses.ct: The LORD replied, "I have forgiven them as you asked.

verses.kjv: But as truly as I live, all the earth shall be filled with the glory of the LORD.
verses.ct: But as surely as I live, and as surely as the whole earth will be filled with the glory of the LORD,

verses.kjv: Because all those men which have seen my glory, and my miracles, which I did in Egypt and in the wilderness, and have tempted me now these ten times, and have not hearkened to my voice;
verses.ct: not one of the people who have seen my glory and the miracles I performed in Egypt and in the wilderness — yet tested me 10 times and refused to listen to me —

verses.kjv: Surely they shall not see the land which I sware unto their fathers, neither shall any of them that provoked me see it:
verses.ct: not one of them will ever see the land I promised to their ancestors with an oath. None of those who treated me with contempt will ever see it.

verses.kjv: But my servant Caleb, because he had another spirit with him, and hath followed me fully, him will I bring into the land whereinto he went; and his seed shall possess it.
verses.ct: But my servant Caleb has a different spirit in him and has followed me wholeheartedly. I will bring him into the land he explored, and his descendants will possess it.

verses.kjv: (Now the Amalekites and the Canaanites dwelt in the valley.) Tomorrow turn you, and get you into the wilderness by the way of the Red sea.
verses.ct: (The Amalekites and the Canaanites were living in the valley.) Tomorrow, turn around and head into the wilderness along the route toward the Red Sea."

verses.kjv: And the LORD spake unto Moses and unto Aaron, saying,
verses.ct: The LORD spoke to Moses and Aaron and said,

verses.kjv: How long shall I bear with this evil congregation, which murmur against me? I have heard the murmurings of the children of Israel, which they murmur against me.
verses.ct: "How long must I put up with this wicked community that keeps complaining against me? I have heard the complaints that the Israelites are making against me.

verses.kjv: Say unto them, As truly as I live, saith the LORD, as ye have spoken in mine ears, so will I do to you:
verses.ct: Tell them, 'As surely as I live,' declares the LORD, 'I will do to you exactly what I heard you say.

verses.kjv: Your carcases shall fall in this wilderness; and all that were numbered of you, according to your whole number, from twenty years old and upward, which have murmured against me,
verses.ct: Your dead bodies will drop in this wilderness — every one of you who was counted in the census, everyone 20 years old and older who has complained against me.

verses.kjv: Doubtless ye shall not come into the land, concerning which I sware to make you dwell therein, save Caleb the son of Jephunneh, and Joshua the son of Nun.
verses.ct: Not one of you will enter the land where I swore to settle you, except Caleb son of Jephunneh and Joshua son of Nun.

verses.kjv: But your little ones, which ye said should be a prey, them will I bring in, and they shall know the land which ye have despised.
verses.ct: But your children — the ones you said would be captured — I will bring them in, and they will enjoy the land you rejected.

verses.kjv: But as for you, your carcases, they shall fall in this wilderness.
verses.ct: As for you, your dead bodies will drop in this wilderness.

verses.kjv: And your children shall wander in the wilderness forty years, and bear your whoredoms, until your carcases be wasted in the wilderness.
verses.ct: Your children will wander in this wilderness for 40 years, suffering the consequences of your unfaithfulness, until every last one of your bodies lies dead in the wilderness.

verses.kjv: After the number of the days in which ye searched the land, even forty days, each day for a year, shall ye bear your iniquities, even forty years, and ye shall know my breach of promise.
verses.ct: Matching the 40 days you spent exploring the land — 1 day for each year — you will carry the weight of your sins for 40 years. Then you will understand what it means to have me against you.'

verses.kjv: I the LORD have said, I will surely do it unto all this evil congregation, that are gathered together against me: in this wilderness they shall be consumed, and there they shall die.
verses.ct: I, the LORD, have spoken. I will certainly do this to every member of this wicked community that has banded together against me. They will meet their end in this wilderness — here they will die."

verses.kjv: And the men, which Moses sent to search the land, who returned, and made all the congregation to murmur against him, by bringing up a slander upon the land,
verses.ct: The men Moses had sent to explore the land — the ones who came back and caused the whole community to complain against him by spreading a negative report about the land —

verses.kjv: Even those men that did bring up the evil report upon the land, died by the plague before the LORD.
verses.ct: those men who spread the bad report about the land were struck dead by a plague in the LORD's presence.

verses.kjv: But Joshua the son of Nun, and Caleb the son of Jephunneh, which were of the men that went to search the land, lived still.
verses.ct: Of all the men who went to explore the land, only Joshua son of Nun and Caleb son of Jephunneh survived.

verses.kjv: And Moses told these sayings unto all the children of Israel: and the people mourned greatly.
verses.ct: When Moses reported all of this to the Israelites, the people grieved deeply.

verses.kjv: And they rose up early in the morning, and gat them up into the top of the mountain, saying, Lo, we be here, and will go up unto the place which the LORD hath promised: for we have sinned.
verses.ct: Early the next morning, they headed up toward the top of the hill country, saying, "Look, we're here! We'll go up to the place the LORD promised, because we realize we have sinned."

verses.kjv: And Moses said, Wherefore now do ye transgress the commandment of the LORD? but it shall not prosper.
verses.ct: But Moses said, "Why are you now disobeying the LORD's command? This will not succeed.

verses.kjv: Go not up, for the LORD is not among you; that ye be not smitten before your enemies.
verses.ct: Don't go up there, because the LORD is not with you. You will be defeated by your enemies.

verses.kjv: For the Amalekites and the Canaanites are there before you, and ye shall fall by the sword: because ye are turned away from the LORD, therefore the LORD will not be with you.
verses.ct: The Amalekites and the Canaanites are waiting for you there, and you will be cut down in battle. Because you have turned away from the LORD, the LORD will not be with you."

verses.kjv: But they presumed to go up unto the hill top: nevertheless the ark of the covenant of the LORD, and Moses, departed not out of the camp.
verses.ct: But they arrogantly marched up toward the hilltop anyway, even though neither the ark of the covenant of the LORD nor Moses left the camp.

verses.kjv: Then the Amalekites came down, and the Canaanites which dwelt in that hill, and smote them, and discomfited them, even unto Hormah.
verses.ct: Then the Amalekites and the Canaanites who lived in that hill country came down, attacked them, and crushed them all the way to Hormah.
